entry.title: Newsletter #120
entry.content:
Hello everyone, for the first newsletter of 2016, we have the final results from our ping pong (TT) competition. After an intense final match between David and Geshan, the winner is… Geshan!

This is how the tournament unfolded in the past weeks:

And yes here is your weekly dose of links we came across in the first week of 2016! Enjoy!!

  • 100 days practicing tdd

  • addyosmani.com – offline installation of npm packages

  • building for http/2

  • docker has turned us all into sysadmins — packt publishing — medium

  • get started with angular 2 by building a simple website – one hungry mind

  • how can i combine two non-sequential git commits into one? – stack overflow

  • how to be a programmer

  • how to tackle the react ecosystem

  • instant web application | better world by better software

  • internet explorer end of support

  • introducing dumb-init, an init system for docker containers

  • javascript frameworks and mobile performance : tom dale

  • learning javascript (part 1)

  • let’s compose some react containers — kadira voice — medium

  • new symfony tips

  • one world, one language — css perverts

  • one year of web components — medium

  • python moving to github

  • react router’s future — rackt and roll — medium

  • react’s jsx: the other side of the coin — medium

  • recipe-oriented documentation

  • sebastian mckenzie: 2015 in review

  • signs that you’re a good programmer – software engineering tips

  • static sites with docker — ilkka.io

  • tdd your api with symfony and phpunit

  • the command line crash course

  • the composer.json schema – autoload dev

  • the end of dynamic languages

  • the future of bundling javascript modules

  • the future of node is in microsoft’s fork

  • the truth about working at a japanese company – the ruby ronin

  • tiny npm package

  • want to learn javascript in 2015 / 2016? — medium

  • welcome to future of web application delivery — medium

  • what good code is? – carlos alexandro becker

  • why did i write a machine learning book in ruby?

  • writing clear code, not clever code

entry.title: Newsletter #68
entry.content:
Hello folks!

News from the tech team: Lucio, Alex, Oba are back from the dockercon that took place in the cold Amsterdam. The conference was a blast, and it was great to see how far Docker became the next big thing in only 21 months.

We have a new pet in the office, the Docker whale! Thanks Lucio for the gift!

It’s #TechThursday at #namshi!

Here is the list with awesome links to keep you busy during the weekend:

  • Meaningful commit messages

  • How to Use npm as a Build Tool

  • Symfony Docker example

  • Rubook.io Solve devOps problems in your sleep with IFTTT-style mitigation of alerts

  • When your IP traffic in AWS disappears into a black hole

  • Operational Efficiency (You’re not Facebook/Google)

  • NGINX Plus and Amazon Elastic Load Balancer on AWS – NGINX

  • Researchers Say POODLE Attack Affects Some TLS Implementations | Threatpost | The first stop for security news

  • SaltStack Delivers More Automation for Docker and LXC Application Containers

  • The real cost of downtime – Server Density

  • The black magic of Engineering management

  • The offline cookbook

  • is ServiceWorker ready?

  • The Huge, Unseen Operation Behind the Accuracy of Google Maps

  • 8 qualities that make great bosses unforgettable

  • Why did Koding switch from containers to VMs?

  • A featherweight PaaS on top of Amazon EC2 for deploying node apps

  • new website for NPM

  • the new Symfony2 VarDumper component

  • 10 stupid rules that drive great employees away

  • physics engine for javascript

  • Meta programming with ECMAScript 6 proxies

  • redis like API on top of localStorage

entry.title: Newsletter #67
entry.content:
Hello folks!

News from the tech team:

Hurray! Namshi turned 3 and we are having a party :). Lucio, Alex, Oba are off to Amsterdam for the dockercon. We hope they are enjoying and get the latest insights about docker. If you are at the dockercon, don’t miss the opportunity to talk to our fellows there, as you know we are hiring.

It’s #TechThursday at #namshi!

Here is the list with awesome links to keep you busy during the weekend:

  • Symfony2 specification by examples

  • BDD – its about value

  • Code Quality By The Numbers – Slides

  • 5 Things a Beginner Developer (and Tester) Should Know About Software Testing

  • List of great dev ops tools

  • Centralized Logging with Logstash and Elasticsearch

  • Schemalessness Gone Wrong: How We Improved Elasticsearch Indexing

  • Creating an advanced Kibana dashboard using a script

  • What About Garbage?

  • Always Multiply Your Estimates by π

  • Why I Like XSLT

  • YOU ARE NOT YOUR RESUME

  • Using JSON Web Tokens as API Keys

  • Static Typing Is Not for Type Checking

  • Google’s mysterious Foobar hiring program investigated

  • Are you a robot? Introducing “No CAPTCHA reCAPTCHA”

  • io,js: nodejs has been forked!

  • Product development = tradeoffs

  • hack.summit(): a real inspiring presentation by Fabien Potencier

  • composer is now faster than before

  • Mermaid: generation of diagram and flowchart from text in a similar manner as markdown
